item.title: ‚ÄúI hate 208w‚Äù: An analysis of anti-celebrity discourse among the popular culture audiences in China (Extended Abstract)
item.description: This is an extended abstract submitted to the Popular Culture Working Group of IAMCR2023. “208w” is the abbreviation for 2.08 million yuan (about $300,000) in Chinese. “208w” is widely used on Chinese social media to refer to high-earning popular celebrities since Chinese actress Zheng Shuang, who allegedly evaded taxes, was exposed that she was paid approximately 2.08 million yuan per day during filming. Unlike anti-fans who target specific celebrities or

item.title: Floating identities: The cross-social media self-presentation of ACG fan community (Extended Abstract)
item.description: This is an extended abstract submitted to the Audience Section of IAMCR2023. Despite the expanding audience size, ACG (Anime-Comics-Games) culture is still considered a subculture in China, whose fans are stereotyped as having ‚Äúsocial withdrawal‚Äù and addicted to the online world.
